List, in chronological order, the titles and complete references to all publications during the past three years and"to representative earlier publications pertinent to this application, DO NOT EXCEED TWO PAGES.
Postgraduate Training:
1973-75 Internship and Residency, New York Hospital-Memorial Hospital, New York, NY 1975-76 Residency, Boston City Hospital, Boston, MA
1976-79 Clinical Associate, National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute, National Insti- tutes of Health, Bethesda, MD
Academic and Hospital Appointments:
1979 Assistant Professor of Medicine, Boston University School of Medicine Boston, MA
1981 Medical Director, Tuberculosis/Pulmonary Clinic, Boston City Hospital, Boston, MA
1986 Medical Director, Allergy Clinic, Boston City Hospital, Boston, MA
Specialty Certification:
1976 American Board of Internal Medicine
1982 Subspecialty Certification - Pulmonary Diseases
Membership In Professional Societies:
American Thoracic Society; Member, Scientific Assembly on Allergy and Clinical Immunology, Nominating Committee, 1983-84.
American Federation for Clinical Research American Lung Association of Boston, Board of Trustees, 1985
Publicat Lons:
1. Crystal, R.G., Fulmer, J.D., Baum, B.J., Bernardo, J, et al .: Cells, collagen and Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Lung 155:199-224, 1978.
2. Bernardo, J., Hunninghake, G., Gadek, J., Ferrans, V.J. and Crystal, R.G .: Acute hypersensitivity pneumonitis: serial changes In lung lymphocyte subpopulations after exposure to antigen. Am. Rev. Respir. Dls. 120:985-994, 1979.
3. Center, D.M. and Bernardo, J .: Hypersensitivity Pneumonia. Disease-A-Month. Volume 27. May, 1981.

5. Keough, B., Bernardo, J., Hunninghake, G.W., Line, B.R., Price, D.L. and Crystal, R.G .: Effect of Intermittent high dose parenteral corticosteroids on the alveolItis of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Am. Rev. Respir. Dis. 127:18-22, 1983.
